title: Which K-pop idols make you cringe? - Quora

response.answer_text: Omg y’all plz don’t hate me for my choices, all of these people I like but sometimes they do things that are so *cringe* RMAEG-NORM is obviously an amazing rapper and talented individual…. but I’m sorry his fancams make me cringe so hard, specifically when he tries to act cute Idk if this is an unpopular opinion, but me and my friend always would cringe bc it just seems like he tries wayyy too hard when he has to do aegyo Like I prefer seeing this:  Over this:  b. Weird English rap lyrics This is a pet peeve for me with a lot of kpop groups, and I know that many idols are not fluent in English but just throwing random English into kpop songs needs to be stopped if y’all are not going to check if they even make sense 💁‍♀️ Example 1: Voices by RMYou can't killCome take it if you do wanna piece of me오직 음악으로 말해 딴 분야 따윈 일 없지If you really think you ready to fly with my powerThis is what R is about, fella the time is now Example 2: Joke by RMYou know I ain't about the thousands, let me ride itYo, drop it, swap it, rock it, mock it, stalk it, lock it in my pocket, there's full of monsters The first one sounds straight off of google translate and the second one is just a jumble of cool sounding English phrases This cringe can be applied to many kpop idols, but I’ve noticed a lot more with RM likely because he often writes his own rap lyrics and I’m aware he’s ~somewhat~ fluent in English 2. The ‘I wanna be an American rapper’ club co-captains Zico and Mino (Winner) Imma be honest… there are so many idols, specifically male, that can fit into this group. Like everytime there’s a ~cool American trend~ naturally many kpop idols will do the dances on shows or during concerts But man these two… it seems like Korea has nominated them as the “ambassadors of anything cool from America”. BUT as an American seeing them imitating our culture sometimes can be so *****cringey*****   Like the fact that they are both milly rocking in 2020 should prove my point enough…. I appreciate that they’re into American culture but sometimes the execution of the moves and the overreaction of the other koreans can be **cringe** 3. ‘Mrs. Steal-your-man-and-your-girl’ Soojin (G-idle) I understand her image in the group is the ~seductress~ but I can’t be the only one who cringes at how blatantly sexual some of these dances can get. Especially in this clip (WARNING: verryyyy blatantly sexual)  Once again this is not just a Soojin issue, many female - and male- kpop idols have had overly sexy concepts (sidenote: don’t get me started on when female idols do the same “sexy dance” for variety shows) I think in general female idols that are overly cutesy or overly sexy can become a little cringey after a while

I think I have cringed at atleast every idol I've ever seen, once. They ALL have their moments, so I'ma say what really makes me cringe. I cringe when idols do aegyo. I dont hate it, but there is a difference in having a natural cuteness or innocence that makes the aegyo come out good to not having a natural cuteness and make it forced out. Forced out aegyo is VERY awkward. Idols I say have natural aegyo that I like are- Sana of twice-  Jimin of bts-  Both jimin and sana have dualities that work in their favor especially since both are known as great performers on stage. They have cuteness and go all out in aegyo but they also still act mature and can be hot lol. But they have had moments where they are trying to be serious but their cuteness comes out. But idols I cringe at heavily are blackpink because their aegyo is very forced. Like when lisa or jennie tend to make their voices high pitched. The girls are actually cute and have youthful features like when they smile and laugh its adorable but I cant get with their aegyo which is the voices and pouting. There are idols who are VERY mature and awkward af but when they do aegyo it's still cute because they naturally get timid by it. An example of a person who isnt aegyo natural like jimin and sana is Bts's RM. His aegyo is cute because even though he has a very mature persona and image, he gets flustered EASILY and that makes one all wanna die from his cuteness. So there are still idols who are mature but still pull off aegyo nicely. Example of RM-   Rm isnt into aegyo or being openly affectionate as jimin or most of the other members ,so he gets embarrassed when he tries to be do aegyo,blow kisses or do hearts and his flustered smiles and covering his face, is what makes it uniquely cute and pure. Other idols do this and it's cute. But there are others that do TOO MUCH. Jhope has aegyo but at times he got extra. He is my bias wrecker, he is a natural sunshine and has a cuteness. He knows how to level it now but before he would force it a bit. His natural cuteness is so sweet tho and. Being extra is his trademark too.  Now I also cringe when idols act all bada$$. And get savage but it doesnt come out right. Bts have their cringey moments in the past too due to their concept but behind camera you can see they get embarrassed by it too. Almost every idol has gone through that era where they try too hard to look cool but its actually cringe but funny even to them. So basically my two biggest issues are when idols force out aegyo or try to hard to be savage, cool or anything. Now on to a short list of things that I also find cringey that almost every idol has done atleast once - 1)idols being rude or savage 2) when they overdo trendy dances like dabbing 3)throw stereotypes of other cultures they think are cool and laugh at it. Like when they talk about black voice, skin, and talk about south asians 4) when they get concepts influenced by other cultures and again its just appropriation and only use it to look cool. I also cringe when they cover latin or spanish songs and try being sexy and dont make choreo that flows with the music. 5) when idols do too much fan service NOT IDOLS but I also cringe at tv hosts when they try to be funny and end up making idols uncomfortable. Western interviews are abit different from korean interviews and shows, but they are still annoying all the same because interviewers whether they are westerners or korean, they are just all awkward except jimin Fallon and James Corden who should be protected. Korean TV hosts can also be rather rude and brutes, like some grab idols too hard or say rude jokes and comments yet laugh it off. That's upsetting and I get second hand embarrassment ,like when female idols are told to sit a certain way or be sexy. Or when hosts try to force male idols to talk about females or topics relating to sexual things ,idols get very awkward about it but since they are guests, they still have to laugh it off. That uncomfortable or awkward tension is so weird for me, it's not just cringey but bothering as a whole.

I personally don’t have anything against BlackPink, but for some reason, these girls are the ones that aggravate me the most when they perform aegyo. I don’t really mind if idols are acting cute, or are forced to act cute because most of the time, they pull it off with their child-like features (like Twice’s Sana and Nayeon, for example), or most just seem natural at it (also Twice but as a whole group, for example). And if they don’t, they openly admit how they either can’t do it (Twice’s Mina) or that they hate it (Twice’s Jeongyeon, I think). I am not that big of a BlackPink fan and am more familiar with Twice as you can tell, so please feel free to correct me or disagree because I may be wrong or a little too unbiased towards some certain members. I’ll talk about each BlackPink member individually and try my best to clearly state my reasons as to not provoke any fans. So first up is . . . Jisoo! Jisoo at times seems natural, as we all know. She is the only member that most people would agree on that isn’t cringy or is the only one who can do it properly. But for me, knowing that she’s the eldest of the group and seeing that she has a more mature side to her, I sometimes lose the fun of it when she just randomly does it without any context. I see her as a motherly figure for the girls so when she acts cute and childish, I don’t know whether to enjoy the content we’re being served or cringe that she’s being like that with younger the members around. And of course, that’s doesn’t mean she can’t. I know she struggles with being the eldest, that she can't cry in front of them because she’s like a strong piller for the girls but . . . I’ve seen her do it a lot of times where it’s unexpected and it just doesn't seem to fit in. It doesn't make sense. But for the most part, she is the only member that I can bear without having to deeply sigh or shake my head because it just seems so out of place. Next up is . . . Jennie. Miss Jenduekie, also seems fine for the most part, but many fans are mainly familiar with the bad(‘a’ word) side that she portrays in their music videos and performances, and her cool and calm demeanor. So despite having amazingly cute features when she really tries, it kinda contrasts heavily with her stage image. When she's natural, she’s natural. But when she's not . . . Well . . . ehh. Moving on . . . Rosé. I'm not huge on BlackPink so I haven't really seen Rosie do aegyo, but she has mature features and a really elegant voice, so I don’t know how'd I feel when I see her act cute. She just doesn't seem like that type of person who'd suddenly act cute out of nowhere to seem more appealing to the public. But if she does, I think I might cringe for a second or two. And lastly . . . Lisa . . . Ok, so don’t get me wrong. I think she’s very talented and I respect her as an idol, and I also get that it can't be helped that she’s the maknae. But to me, it seems like she takes the roll too seriously, like, she wants the world know that she's the youngest every time she’s around the members. That “Purple Lisa! Purple Lisa!” still makes me cringe myself outta the room till this day. I personally am not in the favor of the way she randomly makes little faces at the camera during Vlives or something, like, I dont find it cute at all. But still, I am in no way implying that I don't like her. It's just my opinion that forced aegyo doesn't suite her at all, no matter how soft and cuddly and cute she looks in blonde hair and a onesie. . .  So I'll be ending this short answer here, and hopefully, I hadn't pulled a string for any of the fans. I know you guys get protective of the girls but these are just my opinions. Feel free to disagree, peeps! No harsh feelings : )

Cringe? Honestly, why would an idol make me cringe? I am living beyond the theory that 99% of the idols act differently off camera and on camera, either better or worse. This is something that many people need to believe in at some point.  This is Lisa. I know she is a nice, Beautiful, and a cute girl. Apparently of course. However, do I know her off camera? No, and I don't know her real personality, I don't know whether she is a bad person or not. And I have no right to assume anything.  This is nayeon. AGAIN, she is an apparently a good, nice person. Off camera? I have no right to assume any single thing, I don't even have the right to assume if she is nice or not! I am only assuming on camera, on WHAT WE SEE. Idols are sometimes being forced to a certain image, Don't get me wrong, I an pretty sure some idols are naturally nice, but we can't be 100% sure all the time when we look at them that they are unless we know them personally. I love nayeon and lisa, I love their personalities on camera. However, I have no clue about my feeling about them off camera, because as long as I've never talked to them personally, I can't have a stable/solid feeling about them. And this goes to EVERY single idol not only lisa and nayeon. (They were only examples).   Before assuming anything about any idol off camera, Remember these two very well, and their recent situations. I know it became boring and repetitive to bring up their names every time you try to point out on of the creepiest kpop theories, but this was needed to be said. ~Peace ✌

I don’t really watch any Got7 content anymore but from what I’ve seen over the past years I gotta say BamBam. I know many people love him for being so hyper-energetic and relatable but whenever I see him doing some “trendy” stuff or yelling about some bullshit, it just makes me cringe. I can’t tell why exactly. I could watch Felix do Fortnite dances all day but when BamBam does it it’s just… something else.

Just one and it’s Mark Lee who is in every freaking unit of NCT, but can’t rap for shit. His voice is whiny and the opposite of how a good rapper sounds. A GOAT rapper sounds deep and raspy. SM may know singers, but their rap knowledge is questionable. It’s like Mark reads line without any passion, even the English verse(s) and it’s his native language. Also, he works too hard to please everyone and only pleases 13 year old girls. SuperM is mostly young men in their late 20’s, he’s out of place and in Dream he’s too old and boring. Taeyong is the only rapper in NCT who can rap with the best of rappers, even in English. Sadly, a few of the best new rappers have died over the last couple of years, no collab with XXX. If “GTA”, which Taeyong wrote and choreographed, was released in the US he would have a serious hit and great MV. Mark Lee is a cute little side kick, but no star power.

LE from Exid I actually like Exid and her but I’m not really a fan of her rap. Her voice just sounds to nasally and babyish and it kinda makes me cringe. Jennie and Lisa Lisa it’s the same with LE. No offense but they say rm is bad at aegyo…👀. I don’t mean this in a rude way but cute isn’t their style and it makes me cringe when they do aegyo. I think that girl crush suits them say better and they should stick with it. Again I don’t mean this in a rude way but Lisa’s lilifilm and swalla dance were pretty cringy. I didn’t really find it dancing I think she was just trying to be sexy but I think that fans really overhyped those clips.

upvoters.user_id: STAN Bts or i will eat your food

response.answer_text: This is my honest opinion so here we go: All Twice MembersThey are just too much, groups like them are reason why I stayed away from Kpop beforeThey act overly “cute” and it’s cringeyThey seem fake and insincere2. ITZY Something about them is repellingThey seem plain fakeThey try too hard to make their concept work but it ain’t it3. Soyeon from GIDLE She tries too hard to look cool and all but it’s not too badshe is a good rapper but not the best like she wants to make people believenot the worst tbhSo far these groups and people come to my mind. I don’t hate them because well I don’t know know their true personality since I see them on screen.

A lot of people say that Sanas aegyo is “natural” but I still find it really cringy LOL She's really cute but sometimes I feel that she is forcing out aegyo because she is so burdened to make headlines and start trends… SMH

Blackpink when they do aegyo not just them but every female idol. I hate aegyo with my soul but when BP does it I hate it even more (i love them btw) cuz their concept is girl crush and they act badass on stage and then do aegyo… my opinion.
Jungwoo. But in a good way. I cringe because it's that cute that it starts to be too funny. I can't help but cringe. I love him.

Golden child A lot of times they are hella akward and I'm cringing sooo hard. Like for example yesterday, Youngtaek danced on a gg song in front of 5 other members and 2 women. I couldn't handle it bcs he was sooo akward hahha. But I love these weirdos to much ^^
-when they do aygeyo -when they try too hard to be cute (licking lips, lip bites, winks) -when they do obviously fake personalities (they overdue it) this doesnt apply to everyone.

response.answer_text: not really an idol in general but more of a concept/trend when male idols rip their shirts or just go on stage with string covering their bosoms. It just makes me uncomfortable btw there are some female idols that have very short(not your average dress that shows safety shorts) and for some reason its not that bad for me i’d rather not but its ok. maybe because im female? idk but just putting it out there so i dont get called sexist o-o
honestly, i think its lisa from blackpink, that time when she said “ GUYS IM THE HOTTEEST OKAY” and i was like bruh shut up, u arrogant bitchh
